intro: Bunchosia lanieri, commonly known as the silky bush or silky tamarillo, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or cooked. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
